titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

scopecontent.p: Mainly letters to Mathew Carey, Philadelphia publisher and economist, and his associates relating to internal improvements, particularly the revival of the Chesapeake and Delaware Canal Company in 1821 and the establishment of the Pennsylvania Society for the Promotion of Internal Improvements in 1825. Correspondents include Joshua Gilpin and Harm Jan Huidekoper. Other miscellaneous papers include notes on various Philadelphia institutions and charitable societies, possibly in preparation for Picture of Philadelphia, a guide to the city.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Library Company of Philadelphia: various Mathew Carey papers and collections.
